attribs.name: repeating_traits_-LCC8R8enCYcAsYay75O_description
attribs.current:
[[4d6d1]][[4d6d1]][[4d6d1]][[4d6d1]][[4d6d1]][[4d6d1]]

These numbers may be arranged in any order.
If you dont like these stats you may do 27-point buy with this calculator: https://5etools.com/statgen.html#pointbuy

attribs.name: repeating_traits_-LCC8zXWnXUzinvvkxqo_description
attribs.current:
Make a token on http://rolladvantage.com/tokenstamp/ upload the token as your character image, and change the character name with this format:

PC Name (Game ID)

This is so the character can be assigned to you and a token can be made even while you are offline. if you fail to follow these instructions the character will eventually get deleted.

attribs.name: repeating_traits_-LctBLxJZdTuY6CS-5JV_description
attribs.current:
As a conduit for divine power, you can cast cleric spells. See chapter 10 for the general rules of spellcasting and chapter 11 for a selection of cleric spells.

Cantrips At 1st level, you know three cantrips of your choice from the cleric spell list. You learn additional cleric cantrips of your choice at higher levels, as shown in the Cantrips Known column of the Cleric table.

Preparing and Casting Spells The Cleric table shows how many spell slots you have to cast your cleric spells of 1st level and higher. To cast one of these spells, you must expend a slot of the spell's level or higher. You regain all expended spell slots when you finish a long rest.

You prepare the list of cleric spells that are available for you to cast, choosing from the cleric spell list. When you do so, choose a number of cleric spells equal to your Wisdom modifier + your cleric level (minimum of one spell). The spells must be of a level for which you have spell slots.

For example, if you are a 3rd-level cleric, you have four 1st-level and two 2nd-level spell slots. With a Wisdom of 16, your list of prepared spells can include six spells of 1st or 2nd level, in any combination. If you prepare the 1st-level spell cure wounds, you can cast it using a 1st-level or 2nd-level slot. Casting the spell doesn't remove it from your list of prepared spells.

You can change your list of prepared spells when you finish a long rest. Preparing a new list of cleric spells requires time spent in prayer and meditation: at least 1 minute per spell level for each spell on your list.

Spellcasting Ability Wisdom is your spellcasting ability for your cleric spells. The power of your spells comes from your devotion to your deity. You use your Wisdom whenever a cleric spell refers to your spellcasting ability. In addition, you use your Wisdom modifier when setting the saving throw DC for a cleric spell you cast and when making an attack roll with one.

Spell save DC = 8 + your proficiency bonus + your Wisdom modifier

Spell attack modifier = your proficiency bonus + your Wisdom modifier

Ritual Casting You can cast a cleric spell as a ritual if that spell has the ritual tag and you have the spell prepared.

Spellcasting Focus You can use a holy symbol (found in chapter 5) as a spellcasting focus for your cleric spells.

attribs.name: repeating_traits_-Ld6FWtJ0KtZXMpXZ2Vp_description
attribs.current:
You can see in dim light within 60
FT as though it were bright light, and in
darkness as if it were dim light. You can not
discern color in darkness, only shades of gray.

attribs.name: repeating_traits_-Ld6Fav9D-ROoDJ8j5gQ_description
attribs.current:
When you reach 7th level, you can
cast the Speak With Plants spell as a 3rd level
spell once, and the ability to do so recharges
when you finish a long rest. Wisdom is your
spellcasting ability for this spell.

attribs.name: repeating_traits_-Ld6FdiIuUagcjeWWw8c_description
attribs.current:
When you are assaulted, your
innate fury channels the spirits of your
massacred ancestors. As a reaction when under
half health, you may add +2 to your AC when
you are targeted by an attack. You must be able
to see the attacker to take this reaction. You
must declare this reaction when you know the
result of the attack roll but before the damage
is applied.

attribs.name: repeating_traits_-Ld6JabwtErZtXwcZ4oZ_description
attribs.current:
- Gain proficency in one of the following
skills of your choice: Arcana, History, Nature, Religion

attribs.name: repeating_traits_-Ld6K5FXVD9-yW1ti-oO_description
attribs.current:
You are of the plant type. Your anatomy is too
complex for the spell Regenerate plants from Book of Lost
Spells to work on you. You must seek healing through
traditional methods humanoids would use. You have a thick
amber sap in the place of blood.

attribs.name: repeating_traits_-Ld6KVmq1o7y0QnBUJPW_description
attribs.current:
Rooted Culture At level 3 you gain access to the
Druidcraft Cantrip.

attribs.name: repeating_traits_-Ld6Kbc1AUZFvPUrHliu_description
attribs.current:
Pod-born though you enter a state of dormancy during
long rests similiar to the way other creatures sleep, you are
immune to any effect that would put you to sleep.

attribs.name: repeating_traits_-Ld6LEPIDU6tinxHvdrQ_description
attribs.current: Thanks to a lifetime of growing food, you are able to discern certain simple information for your allies. Your can accurately predict the weather in your area for the next week. You know what food is worth and what you can haggle for better price for produce. Additionally when looking for shelter in farmlands, common folk are always willing to help you so long as you offer aid. They will not help protect you from the law if it would bring harm to themselves.

attribs.name: personality_traits
attribs.current: I couldn't wait to get out of my small life in the farmlands and into the wide world

attribs.name: ideals
attribs.current: Don't put of tomorrows work that can be done today. Laziness is a vice

attribs.name: bonds
attribs.current: I was born in bondage but earned my freedom. I will become rich enough to free them

attribs.name: repeating_traits_-Ld7T0wWlcm5nq12uQZc_description
attribs.current:
As a conduit for divine power, you can cast cleric spells. See chapter 10 for the general rules of spellcasting and chapter 11 for a selection of cleric spells.

Cantrips At 1st level, you know three cantrips of your choice from the cleric spell list. You learn additional cleric cantrips of your choice at higher levels, as shown in the Cantrips Known column of the Cleric table.

Preparing and Casting Spells The Cleric table shows how many spell slots you have to cast your cleric spells of 1st level and higher. To cast one of these spells, you must expend a slot of the spell's level or higher. You regain all expended spell slots when you finish a long rest.

You prepare the list of cleric spells that are available for you to cast, choosing from the cleric spell list. When you do so, choose a number of cleric spells equal to your Wisdom modifier + your cleric level (minimum of one spell). The spells must be of a level for which you have spell slots.

For example, if you are a 3rd-level cleric, you have four 1st-level and two 2nd-level spell slots. With a Wisdom of 16, your list of prepared spells can include six spells of 1st or 2nd level, in any combination. If you prepare the 1st-level spell cure wounds, you can cast it using a 1st-level or 2nd-level slot. Casting the spell doesn't remove it from your list of prepared spells.

You can change your list of prepared spells when you finish a long rest. Preparing a new list of cleric spells requires time spent in prayer and meditation: at least 1 minute per spell level for each spell on your list.

Spellcasting Ability Wisdom is your spellcasting ability for your cleric spells. The power of your spells comes from your devotion to your deity. You use your Wisdom whenever a cleric spell refers to your spellcasting ability. In addition, you use your Wisdom modifier when setting the saving throw DC for a cleric spell you cast and when making an attack roll with one.

Spell save DC = 8 + your proficiency bonus + your Wisdom modifier

Spell attack modifier = your proficiency bonus + your Wisdom modifier

Ritual Casting You can cast a cleric spell as a ritual if that spell has the ritual tag and you have the spell prepared.

Spellcasting Focus You can use a holy symbol (found in chapter 5) as a spellcasting focus for your cleric spells.

attribs.name: repeating_traits_-Ld7T0wfnVrvx8HBQCoQ_description
attribs.current:
At 2nd level, you gain the ability to channel divine energy directly from your deity, using that energy to fuel magical effects. You start with two such effects: Turn Undead and an effect determined by your domain. Some domains grant you additional effects as you advance in levels, as noted in the domain description.

When you use your Channel Divinity, you choose which effect to create. You must then finish a short or long rest to use your Channel Divinity again.

Some Channel Divinity effects require saving throws. When you use such an effect from this class, the DC equals your cleric spell save DC.

Beginning at 6th level, you can use your Channel Divinity twice between rests, and beginning at 18th level, you can use it three times between rests. When you finish a short or long rest, you regain your expended uses.

Turn Undead As an action, you present your holy symbol and speak a prayer censuring the undead. Each undead that can see or hear you within 30 feet of you must make a Wisdom saving throw. If the creature fails its saving throw, it is turned for 1 minute or until it takes any damage.

A turned creature must spend its turns trying to move as far away from you as it can, and it can't willingly move to a space within 30 feet of you. It also can't take reactions. For its action, it can use only the Dash action or try to escape from an effect that prevents it from moving. If there's nowhere to move, the creature can use the Dodge action.

attribs.name: repeating_traits_-Ld7TDQpnvk2L1KdP11j_description
attribs.current:
You have trained to master the use of heavy armor, gaining the following benefits:

Increase your Strength score by 1, to a maximum of 20.

You gain proficiency with heavy armor.

attribs.name: repeating_traits_-Ld7TMisdsLc5cBnVyzA_description
attribs.current:
Pursuit of Peace
At 1st level, you learn to speak the tenets of your faith to
incredible effect. You gain proficiency in the Persuasion and
Religion skills. Whenever you successfully charm or
persuade a hostile creature to perform a peaceful action, you
gain temporary hit points equal to your Wisdom modifier.

attribs.name: repeating_traits_-Ld7TW4AiGFqRAee3BmY_description
attribs.current:
Vow of Pacifism
Also at 1st level, you take an oath to avoid violence against
other creatures. Whenever you finish a long rest, you gain the
following benefits.
Your AC increases by your Wisdom modifier, and attacks
against you are made with disadvantage.
You have advantage on all saving throws.
You are immune to the frightened condition.
Whenever you inflict damage on a creature or perform an
action that inflicts a condition other than charmed or
frightened on a hostile target, you lose these benefits. The

benefits and drawbacks of this vow do not apply to non-
sentient plants, constructs, or mindless beings such as

zombies or oozes.

attribs.name: repeating_traits_-Ld7TdU3nBRSX7ofDlo5_description
attribs.current:
Channel Divinity: Perfect Shelter
At 2nd level, your deity can intervene through you. As an
action, you can use your Channel Divinity feature to evoke a
wave of preserving energy. Creatures other than you within a
10-foot radius around you gain immunity to damage until the
end of your next turn. You can use your action each round to
maintain this effect without expending additional uses of your
Channel Divinity. Creatures that attack or otherwise violate
the conditions of your vow are immediately no longer subject
to this immunity for the duration of the current use.

attribs.name: flaws
attribs.current: I got a girl pregnant and then ran away from the wedding. A decision I regret. I am prone to simply running away from difficult situations instead of confronting them.

attribs.name: repeating_traits_-Ld7WgS2DgvNW8JA091g_description
attribs.current: When you cast a cantrip that forces an enemy to make a saving throw, and the enemy succeeds, you may choose to (as a bonus action) envoke divine sight. The enemy then takes half damage on a success instead of no damage. At level 15 this ability no longer requires the use of a bonus action.

attribs.name: repeating_spell-cantrip_-Ld7bWK03nNjwxRC0w4q_spelldescription
attribs.current: You touch one willing creature. Once before the spell ends, the target can roll a d4 and add the number rolled to one ability check of its choice. It can roll the die before or after making the ability check. The spell then ends.

attribs.name: repeating_spell-cantrip_-Ld7bX13fPZ1mHW3gZRZ_spelldescription
attribs.current:
Flame-like radiance descends on a creature that you can see within range. The target must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw or take 1d8 radiant damage. The target gains no benefit from cover for this saving throw.

The spell's damage increases by 1d8 when you reach 5th level (2d8), 11th level (3d8), and 17th level (4d8).

attribs.name: repeating_spell-cantrip_-Ld7bXm8KPZP-mRtIRHa_spelldescription
attribs.current: You touch a living creature that has 0 hit points. The creature becomes stable. This spell has no effect on undead or constructs.

attribs.name: repeating_spell-1_-Ld7ddW7ErANIUi1Q5sA_spelldescription
attribs.current: This spell lets you convince a beast that you mean it no harm. Choose a beast that you can see within range. It must see and hear you. If the beast's Intelligence is 4 or higher, the spell fails. Otherwise, the beast must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or be charmed by you for the spell's duration. If you or one of your companions harms the target, the spell ends.

attribs.name: repeating_spell-1_-Ld7ddW7ErANIUi1Q5sA_spellathigherlevels
attribs.current: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, you can affect one additional beast for each slot level above 1st.

attribs.name: repeating_spell-1_-Ld7deUl0xonLjhZryXz_spelldescription
attribs.current:
You ward a creature within range against attack. Until the spell ends, any creature who targets the warded creature with an attack or a harmful spell must first make a Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, the creature must choose a new target or lose the attack or spell. This spell doesn't protect the warded creature from area effects, such as the explosion of a fireball.

If the warded creature makes an attack, casts a spell that affects an enemy, or deals damage to another creature, this spell ends.

attribs.name: repeating_spell-2_-Ld7dfEnERz7AQ6AQgSg_spelldescription
attribs.current:
You attempt to suppress strong emotions in a group of people. Each humanoid in a 20-foot-radius sphere centered on a point you choose within range must make a Charisma saving throw; a creature can choose to fail this saving throw if it wishes. If a creature fails its saving throw, choose one of the following two effects.

You can suppress any effect causing a target to be charmed or frightened. When this spell ends, any suppressed effect resumes, provided that its duration has not expired in the meantime.

Alternatively, you can make a target indifferent about creatures of your choice that it is hostile toward. This indifference ends if the target is attacked or harmed by a spell or if it witnesses any of its friends being harmed. When the spell ends, the creature becomes hostile again, unless the DM rules otherwise.

attribs.name: repeating_spell-2_-Ld7dfEnERz7AQ6AQgSg_spelltarget
attribs.current: Each humanoid in a 20-foot-radius sphere centered on a point within range

attribs.name: repeating_spell-1_-Ld7dfuJhZM9c7bYGt8B_spelldescription
attribs.current: A creature you touch regains a number of hit points equal to 1d8 + your spellcasting ability modifier. This spell has no effect on undead or constructs.

attribs.name: repeating_spell-1_-Ld7dfuJhZM9c7bYGt8B_spellathigherlevels
attribs.current: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the healing increases by 1d8 for each slot level above 1st.

attribs.name: repeating_spell-1_-Ld7dgLWUhlUAVUUZi1f_spelldescription
attribs.current: A creature of your choice that you can see within range regains hit points equal to 1d4 + your spellcasting ability modifier. This spell has no effect on undead or constructs.

attribs.name: repeating_spell-1_-Ld7dgLWUhlUAVUUZi1f_spellathigherlevels
attribs.current: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the healing increases by 1d4 for each slot level above 1st.

attribs.name: repeating_spell-2_-Ld7doXs2zjLhMpuMJwG_spelldescription
attribs.current: For the duration, no sound can be created within or pass through a 20-foot-radius sphere centered on a point you choose within range. Any creature or object entirely inside the sphere is immune to thunder damage, and creatures are deafened while entirely inside it. Casting a spell that includes a verbal component is impossible there.

attribs.name: repeating_spell-1_-Ld7dpF4rf6Oy1FC9oVF_spelldescription
attribs.current:
Until the spell ends, one willing creature you touch is protected against certain types of creatures: aberrations, celestials, elementals, fey, fiends, and undead.

The protection grants several benefits. Creatures of those types have disadvantage on attack rolls against the target. The target also can't be charmed, frightened, or possessed by them. If the target is already charmed, frightened, or possessed by such a creature, the target has advantage on any new saving throw against the relevant effect.

attribs.name: repeating_spell-1_-Ld7dpF4rf6Oy1FC9oVF_spellcomp_materials
attribs.current: holy water or powdered silver and iron, which the spell consumes

attribs.name: repeating_spell-2_-Ld7e0ar4YHf5RvFi3l2_spelldescription
attribs.current: Choose a humanoid that you can see within range. The target must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or be paralyzed for the duration. At the end of each of its turns, the target can make another Wisdom saving throw. On a success, the spell ends on the target.

attribs.name: repeating_spell-2_-Ld7e0ar4YHf5RvFi3l2_spellcomp_materials
attribs.current: a small, straight piece of iron

attribs.name: repeating_spell-2_-Ld7e0ar4YHf5RvFi3l2_spellathigherlevels
attribs.current: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, you can target one additional humanoid for each slot level above 2nd. The humanoids must be within 30 feet of each other when you target them.

attribs.name: repeating_spell-2_-Ld7e3oxONZfyExFmugW_spelldescription
attribs.current: Up to six creatures of your choice that you can see within range each regain hit points equal to 2d8 + your spellcasting ability modifier. This spell has no effect on undead or constructs.

attribs.name: repeating_spell-2_-Ld7e3oxONZfyExFmugW_spellathigherlevels
attribs.current: When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, the healing increases by 1d8 for each slot level above 2nd.

attribs.name: repeating_inventory_-Ld7fv89iV-THViLO8r-_itemcontent
attribs.current: You have a +2 bonus to AC while wearing this armor.

attribs.name: repeating_inventory_-Ld7fv89iV-THViLO8r-_itemmodifiers
attribs.current: Item Type: Heavy Armor, AC: 18, Ac +2

/w @{character_name} &{template:npcaction} {{rname=Favorite Spells}} {{description=Favorite Spells are the first spells in each level of your spellbook.
